sentences.sContent: We want to dispel the myth that you cannot eat well in Britain.
sentences.sCn: 我们要消除在英国吃不好的误解。

sentences.sContent: Light poured into the hall, dispelling the shadows.
sentences.sCn: 阳光洒进大厅，驱散了阴影。

remMethod.val: dis(分离) + pel(推) → 往不同的方向推 → 驱散

trans.tranCn: 驱散， 驱逐； 消除
trans.tranOther: to make something go away, especially a belief, idea, or feeling
